snippet: During and after the financial crisis, emerging economies like Brazil and India tended to post rising orders, but in both July and August those countries reported declines for the first time since March 2009.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column on rise of developed economies, says that during and after United States financial crisis, both manufacturing and service companies in emerging markets have outperformed counterparts in developed world, but now that trend has shifted.
lead_paragraph: During and after the financial crisis, emerging economies like Brazil and India tended to post rising orders, but in both July and August those countries reported declines for the first time since March 2009.

headline.print_headline: Now It’s the Developed Nations’ Turn to Grow
headline.main: Now It’s the Developed Nations’ Turn to Grow
